Content: it wot combine utxo's

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you can only trade the size of the alrgest one... and if there was a "swap never started" it till lock the UTXO until you restart or some X time elapses

Author: c2k#4915
Content: ok i will restart and try again

Author: c2k#4915
Content: still get same message

Author: c2k#4915
Content: you said i can only trade the size of the largest utxo?

Author: c2k#4915
Content: weird thing is im getting these messages when i use manual offer. but if i use offer bot i dont get that popup. frustrating

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: offerbot will itterate UTXO's and use the largest one.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: say your balance is 200 but the largest UTXO is 80 KMD, you cannot use 90 KMD as an offer

Author: c2k#4915
Content: my largest utxo is 30 and im trying to sell 100

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you can't do that...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: unless you combine them together first

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: provided the bob has a UTXO big enough to facilitate that trade.

Author: c2k#4915
Content: ok. all way over my head really

Author: c2k#4915
Content: been using bdex for months

Author: c2k#4915
Content: but never easy for me

Author: c2k#4915
Content: is hyperdex the same when it comes to managing utxo's?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: its never easy lol... HyperDEX is heaps easier

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it will just use the largest UTXO, so you try sell 100 and have 30 UTXO it will just sell 30.

Author: c2k#4915
Content: gotcha

Author: c2k#4915
Content: but on hdex i dont have to worry about utxo?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: not exactly.... It still uses them the same way behind the scenes.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but it wont throw errors at you talking about it

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: as long as you have at least 2 of them it usually works

Author: c2k#4915
Content: and i can use my bdex keys so my balance shows in there?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes they use the same keys

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: One of the reasons for this is because there are some binaries from OSX and Linux on the Windows version of the app. This will be removed in future versions.

Author: tolken#2655
Content: @cipi the issue turned out to be a couple things at least. The Client_OSX as it comes from github seems incorrect, adding a redundant path. Secondly before bdex would see komodod where Agama installed it, BarterDex this doesn‚Äôt seem to work. To get it to work, I find komodod installed by Agama and explicit path to the config and it worked running outside Agama. Yes I had marketmaker running.

Author: Shinsoo#0021
Content: looks like my komodo coins got stolen from my wallet :(

Author: Shinsoo#0021
Content: whats the most secure way of storing komodo coins? Can someone please share?

Author: yorklab#7270
Content: If using Lite mode, I keep my seed/passphrase on a separate USB that also needs a password for access. Many like to write the passphrase on a separate piece of paper.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: @Shinsoo I  would suggest to please send us a ticket at support@komodoplatform.com . Here is not so easy to review what could be the situation that you faced. In the ticket please send us the details of your wallet version and mode. We would make sure to give you back a possible solution if there is.

Author: yorklab#7270
Content: @Shinsoo Just an FYI. From experience I can tell you that if in Lite mode, most people who think their coins are gone, eventually find that they simply typed in the wrong passphrase/seed, so Agama will display a different address. A space before or after the phrase will give you a different address.

Content: Which coin is it?

Author: AndronicusBass#7784

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: Have you tried a resync from scratch ? Try this guide when you enter Komodo folder select the EQL and do the same procedure https://komodoplatform.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/KPSD/pages/162562089/Agama+Windows+Guide+How+to+Resync+from+scratch

Content: If that doesn‚Äôt help send us a ticket at support@komodoplatform.com with the debug log if possible.

Author: AndronicusBass#7784
Content: I have unfortunately. It just wont move beyond 96% and tried daemon param selection reindex from disk, rescan and also gen

Author: AndronicusBass#7784
Content: Deleted everything in the folder except wallet.dat

Author: AndronicusBass#7784
Content: then executed agama with the command argument zapwallettxes=2

Author: Shinsoo#0021
Content: @yorklab no mine is gone to a private addresa after 20 days of back and forth email with support

Author: Shinsoo#0021
Content: @yorklab which usb do u use  to keep ur pw? Also which walet u use?

Author: yorklab#7270
Content: I have both Lite and Native Agama wallet. You can use any USB drive then, if in Windows, you can use Bitlocker (comes with Windows) you can password protect the USB drive.

Author: yorklab#7270
Content: I like to use Lite mostly because of the ability to protect my passphrase in a separate secure location.

Author: Shinsoo#0021
Content: okay thanks york

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: If what you are saying is correct , then I will suggest for you to see any vector that could have a vulnerability  and create a wallet from another PC  and another network as well because there is no current form that Agama on lite mode would send a transaction if the user is the only one controlling  their passphrase. If you are using native mode a rescan should help in viewing all of the change addresses inside the wallet. If not my personal suggestion would be to create a wallet in a new machine and make sure that your environment hasn't being compromised. @Shinsoo
